salve, ringrazio ho spostato tutto in imap e non ho perso nessuna mail.

content: La procedura probabilmente migliore è di creare le cartelle di cui hai bisogno sul server. Poi le selezioni su Thunderbird in modo che vengano sincronizzate -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/sincronizzazione-imap#w_configurazione-della-sincronizzazione-ed-utilizzo-dello-spazio-sul-disco
creator: @next

content:
Purtroppo Thunderbird ti può mostrare solo ciò che il server gli invia. Sarebbe utile se potessi fare un test con un programma differente per vedere se il problema è in Thunderbird o in Outlook.com. Oppure potresti creare una nuova cartella in Outlook (e spostare la posta della cartella Amazon in questa nuova cartelle). Poi verificare se Thunderbird la vede.

p.s. Questo forum è pubblico su Internet. Nelle immagini che hai pubblicato si vedono molti dati privati per cui provvederò a rimuoverle. Se devi pubblicare immagini assicurati di oscurare i dati privati.
creator: @next

content:
Very sorry for the tardy reply to the helpful responses regarding my download issue. I did finally get everything working again by reconfiguring the download settings in Thunderbird. The only problem was that this involved downloading every message from my Comcast message store (over 45K messages) into my Thunderbird inbox. I realize I should be deleting old and unwanted messages from Comcast and plan to start doing that to avoid this from happening again. I've been using Thunderbird for many years and love it for organizing important messages. But I do have these recurring download issues which have been very frustrating.

Another quick note - I use the Carbonite app for cloud storage of my PC hard drive. When my hard drive crashed some time ago, restoring my Thunderbird profile folder required a huge amount of effort and a lot of trial and error. I finally got the job accomplished and wrote full directions in case the system crashes again. If any other users have similar issues with Carbonite backup, I'd be happy to share my experiences.
creator: aaronridge

content:
Se succede su tutti gli account, è probabile che la causa sia l'antivirus. Spesso disattivarlo non è sufficiente perché alcune impostazioni restano comunque attive.

L'altra possibile causa è il firewall.

Se invece succede solo per uno dei tuoi account, allora la causa è probabilmente diversa.

content:
Hello there We have read your message. We try to help you.

You can recieve messages. You cannot send email messages.

try to check your smtp configuration for the outgoing mail messages. These may have changed during, for example, an update for a new version of software.

This is then called an error. and sending the mail to the desired persons or mail bots are then prevented.

we can see if the correct information has been entered if you can send me the data of the incoming mails and outgoing mails? Smtp settings .

can you find it in your personal computer?




greetings firefox volunteer.

content:
I'm closing this thread in a few days. I tried every variation I can imagine on my windows 7 desktop. For example, I turned off windows defender (not trivial to do). I turned off windows firewall (not trivial to do). I turned off / uninstalled malwarebytes. I tried many combinations of TB settings. I reviewed the gmail settings. Yet I was never able to connect TB to either gmail imap or gmail smtp. There was always an authentication failure.

In contrast, my windows 7 laptop TB easily connected to both gmail imap or gmail smtp, very easy to do. That connection will suffice for my purposes. Instead of using the gmail smtp server on the desktop, I found sendgrid smtp server which works well. I wish I had a backup smtp server, but I just have to hope that the sendgrid server continues to work. I can use the laptop gmail imap connection to help clean up files better than the clunky gmail interface.

I give up trying to make it work. It is just too frustrating trying to diagnose this problem, because I lack the diagnostic tools to tell me EXACTLY what is causing the authentication failure. It seems something to do with the desktop windows 7 configuration, since the windows 7 laptop works perfectly, and because countless other people easily connect. But just guessing and floundering like I am doing is a time waster. The lack of diagnostic detail makes this a frustrating problem for many, as I have seen many other posts with basically similar problem.

I appreciate the response I received, even though not helpful to solve the problem. Given the apparently irreproducible nature of the problem, seems something local with my windows 7 setup, the only response that would have helped would be to point me toward some TB or windows or gmail diagnostic tool that gives more detail why the authentication fails. I tried all the TB developer tools, such as error console, but not helpful at all. I could not find any gmail / google diagnostic logs relevant to help solve this authentication problem. Any diagnostic tool someone would suggest? Otherwise, will close thread in a few days. Thanks
creator: dgoldman1

creator: dgoldman1

content:
re :Do I need to set up a google app password for this to work? I previously thought it was required and have one set up.

If you have set up 2 step authentication in gmail then when you try to create the mail account gmail will expect that google app password and not the normal password you use to access webmail. This probably explains why you are getting the pop up that says " “Unable to log in at server. Probably wrong configuration, username, or password”. "

If you disable that 2 step verification then you can just enter the normal password when creating the account and when verifying in the gmail popup to allow Thunderbird.
creator: Toad-Hall

content: Thanks for responding. I didn't explicitly say so, but I did "try every variation", including your good suggestion, and it did not work. Originally, I was using 2 step authentication. On Windows 7 desktop, would not authenticate when A) trying to send an email from TB using gmail smtp server, and B) trying to have TB read gmail imap server, as previously explained. Later, I got tired of the repeated 2 step authentication and so disabled it. The results were the same: A) and B would not authenticate on desktop. Later, I tested from a TB install (same TB version) on a windows 7 laptop (same OS version). Authenticated perfectly and easily. Again, I believe there is something local on the desktop computer. Everything in TB and gmail is the same between desktop and laptop, but desktop fails to authenticate. Unless there is some better diagnostic tool, I'm giving up. It is too inefficient guessing. Thanks
creator: dgoldman1

content:
Ciao, anzitutto questo è solo un forum di utenti. In secondo luogo Thunderbird è un programma che opera localmente sul tuo computer, nessuno può manovrarlo da remoto.

Per il resto, le informazioni che hai fornito sono troppo limitate per poterti suggerire delle soluzioni. A me sembra strano che all'improvviso ti arrivino migliaia di email di phishing. Sicura che non sia un problema dell'antivirus? Inoltre, se puoi accedere al server tramite webmail, potresti eliminare tutti i messaggi di phishing evitando di doverli scaricare con Thunderbird.
